TopicDetails.title: Model, Tools, Simulation and Integration
TopicDetails.callTitle: Clean Sky 2 Call for Core Partners Wave 1
keywords: LGB Landing gear and braking systems
HUM Aircraft health and usage monitoring system
TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

Modelling at aircraft level and measurement of new systems impact on overall architecture. Trade-off studies on breakthrough technologies. Development of simulation libraries and models to be customized by demonstrators designers. Core modelling environment with modular layers for customisation to specific aircraft platform and targeted technical area.

Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex I of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
TopicDetails.conditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.
The budget breakdown for this call is given in the topic list (see below for section 8: Clean Sky Additional Documents).

 

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding:
    Described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions:
    Described in parts B & C of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold:
    Described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Rules for the submission and evaluation process:
    Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for Core Partners

     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout:
    For Part B of the proposal the limit is 50 pages. A template for Part B is provided in section 6 (below).

     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
     
  6. Specific Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms:
    Clean Sky 2 Innovation Action (CS2-IA)
    Specific provisions and funding rates
    Standard proposal template
    Standard evaluation form
    Clean Sky 2 JU Model Grant Agreement for Members

     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

     
  8. Clean Sky JTI additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Summary list of topics in the call 2014
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CPW-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

latestInfos.content:
16 October 2014:   Release 6 of the Question & Answers document has been published in the Additional Documents Section.

 

Also, please note that the following changes were made to this call on 01 October 2014:

  • The closing date of the call was extended by 3 weeks from 15 October to 05 November

  • The Q&A mailbox was re-opened and will accept questions until the end of Friday 03 October

  • The template for Part B.I was updated. The changed sections are indicated in red text.

  • The embedded tables in Part B.I are available also now as an Excel file in the download ZIP of templates.

  • A Model Consortium Agreement has been provided in the Information Package section

  • An extensive new version of the Question & Answers document is published in the Additional Documents Section

  • Form A has been updated to correct an error in the selection of the funding rate (70% vs 100%)

  • The page size limit for Part B.I has been increased from 50 to 70.

To locate the Q&A document see the end of the "CALL DOCUMENTS" section. Just click on the "Call Documents" tab above and then scroll down.

To download the Excel version of the Part B.I tables you need to enter the submission system and click on "Download Templates" on the screen called "Step 5 - Edit Proposal".

The following changes were made to this call on 01 October 2014:

  • The closing date of the call was extended by 3 weeks from 15 October to 05 November
     
  • The Q&A mailbox was re-opened and will accept questions until the end of Friday 03 October
     
  • The template for Part B.I was updated. The changed sections are indicated in red text.
     
  • The embedded tables in Part B.I are available also now as an Excel file in the download ZIP of templates.
     
  • A Model Consortium Agreement has been provided in the Information Package section
     
  • An extensive new version of the Question & Answers document is published in the Additional Documents Section
     
  • Form A has been updated to correct an error in the selection of the funding rate (70% vs 100%)
     
  • The page size limit for Part B.I has been increased from 50 to 70.

To locate the Q&A document see the end of the "CALL DOCUMENTS" section. Just click on the "Call Documents" tab above and then scroll down.

To download the Excel version of the Part B.I tables click on the "Download all Documents" button in the "CALL DOCUMENTS" section.  You will find the Excel file in the ZIP.

Release 4 of the Question and Answers document was uploaded to this web site on 12 September. It is available at the end of the "CALL DOCUMENTS" section. Just click on the "Call Documents" tab above and then scroll down.

New questions can still be submitted until 15 September for the next release of this document.

The link to the CSJU Model Grant Agreement, which is in the topic documents section, is now also provided in the call documents section alongside the link to the annotated grant agreement for convenience.

Also, as a reminder, the standard proposal template was also revised recently and is now available for download in section 6 of each topic under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents”.

The updates regard the following paragraphs of part B:
• 1.6 Complementary activities;
• 3.4 Risk management

As a result the following tables were revised to reflect these changes:
• Table 3.1.a – List of Work Packages
• Table 3.1.b – Work Package Descriptions
• Table 3.1.c – Work Package Effort
• Table 3.2 – List of identified critical risks and the mitigating measures foreseen
• Table 3.3 – Budget summary

Finally, note that the “annotated Grant Agreement” has been added to the full set of documents available for download under the tab “call documents” and in the section of Additional Documents of each topic under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents”.
This document might be useful for applicants looking for further explanations on articles of the Model Grant Agreement.

The submission session is now available for: JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-03(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-04(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-01-03(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-03-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-03-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-04-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-FRC-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-FRC-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-03(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-04(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-05(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-06(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-REG-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-REG-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-REG-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-SYS-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-SYS-03-01(CS2-IA)

The Part B Template is now available for download in section 6 of each topic under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents.

An updated version of the Work Plan 2014-2015 has also been published. The only change is to the topic AIR-01-01.

Contact details for the States Representative Group are now published under the "Get Support" Tab.

All information to prepare a proposal is therefore available but the questions can still be submitted via the official channel in the get support section. Therefore applicants should check for future releases of the Q&A document. The facility for uploading proposals will be opened in due course.

Just a reminder that 1 week ago:

  • Release 1 of the Questions & Answers document was published at the end of the "CALL DOCUMENTS" section. Just click on the "Call Documents" tab above and then scroll down.
  • Misleading references to "Research and Innovation Actions" (RIA) were removed. All topics in this call are "Innovation Actions" (IA).
  • A problem with the link for downloading the Joint Technical Programme, which occured some time after the call publication, was fixed. This is a very large document and may take some time to download depending on the speed of your internet connection.

The submission session is now available for: JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-03(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-AIR-02-04(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-01-03(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-03-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-03-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-ENG-04-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-FRC-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-FRC-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-03(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-04(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-05(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-01-06(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-LPA-02-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-REG-01-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-REG-01-02(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-REG-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-SYS-02-01(CS2-IA), JTI-CS2-CPW-SYS-03-01(CS2-IA)

Release 1 of the Questions & Answers document is now available at the end of the "CALL DOCUMENTS" section. Just click on the "Call Documents" tab above and then scroll down.

Misleading references to "Research and Innovation Actions" (RIA) have been removed from this call web site. All topics in this call are "Innovation Actions" (IA).

A problem with the link for downloading the Joint Technical Programme, which occured some time after the call publication, has now been fixed. Please note that this is a very large document and therefore may take some time to download depending on the speed of your internet connection.

The Part B Template, contact details for the States Representative Group and a modification to the topic AIR-01-01 will be published on this web site around the end of July. 
Further release(s) of the Q & A document will also be published as required so potential applicants are advised to re-visit this web page periodically.

By clicking on any one of the 29 topics listed below you will immediately see a short description of the topic.
From there you can click on the adjacent tab  "Topic Conditions and Documents"  to see all relevant documents.

In the document  "Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014 / 2015"  the full, detailed, topic descriptions begin after page 259 (Annex I).
